article_title: NLRB Targets Hobby Lobby Handbook Rules
article_text:
NLRB Targets Hobby Lobby Handbook Rules

Law360, New York (April 25, 2016, 7:33 PM ET) -- Several of Hobby Lobby’s employee handbook rules violate labor laws, counsel for the National Labor Relations Board told an administrative law judge Friday, backing claims made by a religious rights group alleging the retailer is hampering employees’ right to organize.



The NLRB’s general counsel told the board’s Administrative Law Judge Gerald M. Etchingham that the arts-and-crafts retailer’s revised employee handbook failed to remedy the “overly broad” rules of an earlier edition, including a policy against “inappropriate conduct” and a confidentiality policy, that restrain employee activity protected...
